page.title: 09HOUSING IN KNIGHTSRIDGE
page.content: The Knightsridge area of Livingston consists of approximately 1100 houses. Most of the houses were built for the Livingston Development Corporation for renting and only a few were built by private builders. Work was started in August 1971 and the first houses were completed by the middle of 1972. Most of the houses are terraced villas of varying sizes from two to seven apartments. There are small houses at ground level for pensioners and some two storey flats. Over the years the people who live in these houses have been complaining about dampness and about the houses being difficult to heat in winter. There is at present a new scheme to help the residents of Knightsridge.It is called the Knightsridge Initiative and should mean considerable changes in the next few years.
